I( have been wondering =
what might happen if one installed a BFO (beat frequency Oscillator) to the=
 radio and then turned the bfo as they were recording. 
Al
---------- Origi=
nal Message ----------
From: Frank Ratka <warrior18eii@ yahoo.com>
To: EVP-=
ITC@yahoogroups .com
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
Date: Mon, 8 Jun 2009=
 12:09:50 -0700 (PDT)








I have a running theory that EVP is carried o=
n an untrasonic wave and demodulated exactly where they want it to manifest=
. It works off the heterodyne principle. If you mix two ultrasonic waves th=
at differ one another in frequency then if you add or subtract them togethe=
r you get a beat frequency or alternate frequency. For example, if a ghost =
is sending a signal at 54KHz and you have an electric fan in a room creatin=
g an untrasonic frequency at 45KHz then you will have a intermediate differ=
ence=A0frequency at 9KHz, well within human hearing range (20Hz to 20KHz). =
This was just an example, but all electronic equipment generates ultrasonic=
 signals just by turning them on. From this theory I always felt that EVP w=
ere generated within a few inches of the recorder.
=A0
We are able to repro=
duce this affect in not only radio with superheterodyne systems but also wi=
th acoustics and audio as in some passive sonars and a commercial produce c=
alled the "audio spotlight" by Dr. Joseph Pompeii.
=A0
Frank R.

Fascinating! I've had this id=
ea that the EVP are often=A0not recorded by the microphone but somehow make=
 their way in at the actual=A0point where the storage is made, whether it b=
e analog (tape) or digital.=A0

So much we don't know ...
=A0
Zack

=A0
On =
Mon, Jun 8, 2009 at 1:39 PM, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostrese=
arch. com> wrote:









I monitor my audio live. The funny thing is that=
 even so, those last EVP's I captured I did not hear either in the environm=
ent, or on my recording as it happened. I only heard them upon playback.
=
=A0


----- Original Message ----- 
From: Zack Widup 

To: EVP-ITC@yahoogro=
ups .com 



Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 11:40 AM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Ne=
w ideas




I am curious if anyone with a microphone wired to a remote site=
 has ever gotten any EVP in real time.
=A0
I=A0took part in=A0an investigat=
ion of Ashmore Estates, near Ashmore IL, on Saturday night. We had six vide=
o cameras set up in the three halls of the building. The video for all=A0wa=
s being monitored and recorded=A0at a central location. Alas, we did not ha=
ve microphones at the camera sites conected to the central location. I wond=
er what we might have heard if we did?
=A0
Zack

=A0

<DIV>I have a running theo=
ry that EVP is carried on an untrasonic wave and demodulated exactly where =
they want it to manifest. It works off the heterodyne principle. If you mix=
 two ultrasonic waves that differ one another in frequency then if you add =
or subtract them together you get a beat frequency or alternate frequency. =
For example, if a ghost is sending a signal at 54KHz and you have an electr=
ic fan in a room creating an untrasonic frequency at 45KHz then you will ha=
ve a intermediate difference frequency at 9KHz, well within human hear=
ing range (20Hz to 20KHz). This was just an example, but all electronic equ=
ipment generates ultrasonic signals just by turning them on. From this theo=
ry I always felt that EVP were generated within a few inches of the recorde=
r.</DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>We are able to reproduce this affect in not=
 only radio with superheterodyne systems but also with acoustics and audio =
as in some passive sonars and a commercial produce called the "audio spotli=
ght" by Dr. Joseph Pompeii.</DIV>
